As [Root.GetSheHe] is your prisoner, you may give the order to permanently blind [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and then setting [Root.GetHerHim] free, as a blind [Root.GetManWoman] is of little threat to the throne.
Tales of your misdeeds are told from Kovir to Zangwebar.
Kings and emperors fought a constant battle with their vassals over privileges, rights and obligations. The nobility, naturally, tended to favor a weak state...

It's hard being a good [Root.Religion.GetName] these days, but my friend truly shocked me when I realized we did not share the same religion. My dear friend is a heretic!
I shall try to convert my friend to the one true faith!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] tries to convert [This.GetTitledFirstName] to a God-fearing [Root.Religion.GetName]
Who cares about religion anyway? I don't!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] accepts that [This.GetTitledFirstName] is a [This.Religion.GetName]
I can't be friends with a heretic!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is no longer friends with [This.GetTitledFirstName]

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is a devout [From.Religion.GetName], so when I told [From.GetHerHim] that I believed in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] rather than [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] I knew what [From.GetSheHe] was going to say. After a long, heated discussion about religion, considered disadvantages and advantages of our respective religions I decided to...
...keep my religion but lose my friend
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] cannot be friends with someone who does not respect [Root.GetHerHis] religion
...keep my friend and convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] religion
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] converts to [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s religion
...keep both my religion and my friend

I feared what [From.GetTitledFirstName] would say when I told [From.GetHerHim] that I did not believe in [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], that I am a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] and I would not give up my religion for anyone. [From.GetTitledFirstName] was more understanding than I would've thought [From.GetHerHim] to be, and after asking some questions [From.GetSheHe] seemed to accept me and my religion.
A friend like you is hard to find, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

It went exactly as I had feared - [From.GetTitledFirstName] couldn't accept me being a [Root.Religion.GetName] and condemned me and my religion. I tried to reason with [From.GetTitledFirstName] and told [From.GetHerHim] about all the similarities with [From.GetHerHis] religion and [From.Religion.GetName] but I was talking to deaf ears.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] decided [From.GetSheHe] couldn't be friends with a heretic

I tried talking to [From.GetTitledFirstName], discuss, argue, everything! Nothing I said, nothing I did could convince [From.GetTitledFirstName] to abandon [From.GetHerHis] heretical ways and embrace the one true faith, the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion. Our disagreement about religion were never solved and [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me I was no longer [From.GetHerHis] friend...
I agree, we can no longer be friends

The difference between a [Root.Religion.GetName] and a [From.Religion.GetName] is that...'\nI reasoned with [From.GetTitledFirstName] about [From.GetHerHis] religion and tried to explain why being a [From.Religion.GetName] in this day and age was a bad idea.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] decided to convert and become a [Root.Religion.GetName]
[From.GetTitledFirstName] did not heed my warning

Honoured [Root.GetTitle],

I am not surprised that you would stoop so low, but your attempt to blackmail me is in vain. I have nothing to hide.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Tell us more about this mythical realm of Haak.
Invite Priest to Court
Scour the land for a priest to join my court and advise me on religious matters.
I will never be better than  Court Mage [Root.Liege.job_mage.GetTitledFirstName].
By the [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], let me through!
Your charity work in [Root.Location.GetName] goes well. The [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] would approve of your Master's actions. Perhaps you should send word.
We can still do much good.
Word has reached you that [From.GetTitledName], has given in to weakness and helped [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the alms [From.GetSheHe] was meant to distribute amongst the poor.
[From.GetTitledName], was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and has been seriously wounded while giving alms to the poor in your name. Charity can be dangerous work.
[From.GetTitledName], who was performing charity work in your name, made the ultimate sacrifice when he was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and trampled to death.
[FromFrom.GetTitledName], reports that [From.GetTitledName] has been humbled by your endless generosity to the poor in [From.Location.GetName]. The peasants are singing your name!
I have been reading [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], and it claims that death is not something a true follower [Root.GetRandomGodName] should be afraid of.
Forgive me [Root.GetRandomGodName], for I have sinned.

You are enjoying a late supper at the Great Palace in Nilfgaard, sampling some new wines brought in from the provinces, when the sound of a distant explosion is heard. Windows shatter and the chandelier above begins to sway as the shockwave hits a second later. Dust trickles down from the roof, and to your dismay some of it lands in your wine.\n\nYou hurry to a balcony overlooking the city and see an intense fire burning at one of the warehouses by the docks. The nearby water in the Geg Alba is also ablaze, and the fire has already spread to several ships in the busy inlet. While their crews are in the process of abandoning them, the harbor area is rocked by a flurry of smaller explosions from the burning warehouse.
